Default Constructor

~Text

public ~Text();
Default Destructor

Method Detail

ChangeText

public void ChangeText( std::string txt );
Changes the text std::string for the object to the specified value.
Parameters:
txt - The new std::string to associate with the object

LoadText

public void LoadText( std::string txt, int x_, int y_, bool visible );
Loads the values for the Text object
Parameters:
txt - The std::string to be displayed and/or read for the text object
x_ - The x coordinate of the text object
y_ - The y coordinate of the text object
vis - true if the text object should be visible, false otherwise

ReadText

public void ReadText( std::string stringToRead, unsigned short volume );
Reads the string parameter using Windows text-to-speech
Parameters:
stringToRead - The string to be read via text-to-speech.
volume - Volume value (0-100)

SetBackgroundColor

public void SetBackgroundColor( int r, int g, int b );
Changes the background color of the text object for display.
Parameters:
r - The amount of red (0-255) in the RGB color.
g - The amount of green (0-255) in the RGB color.
b - The amount of blue (0-255) in the RGB color.

SetColor

public void SetColor( int r, int g, int b );
Changes the foreground color of the text object for display.
Parameters:
r - The amount of red (0-255) in the RGB color.
g - The amount of green (0-255) in the RGB color.
b - The amount of blue (0-255) in the RGB color.

SetPosition

public void SetPosition( int x_, int y_ );
Sets the new position of the text on screen to (x,y)
Parameters:
x_ - New x coordinate of the text position
y_ - New y coordinate of the text position

SetSize

public void SetSize( int sz );
Changes the pixel size of the text object for display.
Parameters:
sz - The pixel size for the text object.

SetVisible

public void SetVisible( int vis );
Changes the visibility of the text object.
Parameters:
vis - The new visibilty. 0 for invisible, non-zero for visible.

ShowText

public void ShowText( bool read, BITMAP* dest );
Displays the text on the specified BITMAP if it is visible and reads the text if specified to do so.
Parameters:
read - true if text-to-speech should be used, false otherwise
dest - Allegro BITMAP on which to display the text
